duration_raw: until the next time you make your daily preparations
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Restricted">[Time Pocket](/Spells.aspx?ID=1192)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 183</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>

<row>1 minute ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** one item of 1 Bulk or less that a willing creature is holding
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You fling the target item forward in time and link it to the future of the creature holding it. The item disappears. When the spell ends, the item reappears with the creature that was holding it when you Cast the Spell. If the creature has enough hands free to hold the item, it appears in their hands. Otherwise, it falls to the ground in the creature's space. 

You can Dismiss the spell, and it automatically ends if you're reduced to 0 Hit Points or cast _time pocket_ again.
name: Time Pocket

<additional-info>

</row>

---

<summary>
Send an object forward in time to arrive at a later date

</summary>

text: Time Pocket Source Dark Archive pg. 183 Traditions Arcane, Occult Cast 1 minute (material, somatic, verbal) Range touch Target one item of 1 Bulk or less that a willing creature is holding Duration until the next time you make your daily preparations --- You fling the target item forward in time and link it to the future of the creature holding it. The item disappears. When the spell ends, the item reappears with the creature that was holding it when you Cast the Spell. If the creature has enough hands free to hold the item, it appears in their hands. Otherwise, it falls to the ground in the creature's space. You can Dismiss the spell, and it automatically ends if you're reduced to 0 Hit Points or cast time pocket again.
